title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:06 <jvelociter\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:07 <@cjdelisle> vmassol: I had not tested on tomcat, maybe that's something to add to the manual testing regime? I tested just now and it seems to start just fine.  
00:07 <vmassol> cjdelisle: yes we found the issue  
00:08 <@cjdelisle> java 1.5?  
00:08 <vmassol> it's working fine on tomcat, it wasn't working on myxwiki.org  
00:08 <vmassol> nope  
00:08 <vmassol> :)  
00:08 <vmassol> the reason is because the work dir oof tomcat was full of directories on myxwiki.org  
00:08 <jvelociter> has quit  
00:08 <jvelociter\_> is now known as <jvelociter>  
00:08 <vmassol> more than 30K directories  
00:08 <@cjdelisle> mmm  
00:08 <vmassol> and the extension manager scans the classapth when XE starts  
00:08 <vmassol> and  
00:08 <@cjdelisle> hehe  
00:09 <@cjdelisle> gotit  
00:09 <vmassol> for some reason the tomcat work dir was in the classpath  
00:09 <vmassol> there were 5GB of data in the work dir  
00:09 <vmassol> that's because we don't clean up when we add attachments  
00:09 <vmassol> we need to fix thi  
00:09 <vmassol> this  
00:10 <@cjdelisle> Attachments (unless using filesystem store) should only go in temp dir and be marked as delete on shutdown  
00:10 <@cjdelisle> ofc an adverse shutdown will prevent that from happening

13:33 <+sburjan> tmortagne: are you experiencing some skype problems ?  
13:46 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I don't think so, you tried to send me messages ?  
13:46 <+tmortagne> ha it just crashed  
13:47 <+tmortagne> cool now it refuse to start...  
13:50 <jamesxu> has quit  
13:51 <venkatesh> has quit  
14:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <vmassol> has quit  
14:06 <+sburjan> tmortagne: i have the same problem. the windows disappears after 4-5 seconds :)  
14:06 <+sburjan> I almost thought I had to reinstall my linux :)  
14:06 <+tmortagne> sburjan: /media/data/projets/xwiki/src/git/tmp/wiki-stream  
14:06 <+tmortagne> oops  
14:06 <+tmortagne> https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/ia32-libs/+bug/788573  
14:07 <+tmortagne> if you are using ubuntu 11.04  
14:08 <+tmortagne> it looks like it's an update from today  
14:08 <+tmortagne> looks like 10.10 has the same issue  
14:10 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <+sburjan> I'm 10.04 :)  
14:31 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:32 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <arkub> has quit  
14:40 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <+sburjan> tmortagne: were you able to fix it ?  
14:45 <+tmortagne> sburjan: it's working again when I delete ~/.Skype  
14:45 <+tmortagne> but then you loose all the configuration  
14:45 <+tmortagne> someone just posted a solution to not remove the whole thing  
14:45 <+sburjan> well then I'll wait so they fix this  
14:45 <+tmortagne> i'm tryying it now  
14:48 <+tmortagne> sburjan: go in the ~/.Skype folder  
14:48 <+tmortagne> and remove just shared.lck and shared.xml  
14:48 <+tmortagne> then it's working  
14:48 <+tmortagne> and you keep the whole history and configuration as far as I can see  
14:48 <+tmortagne> let me check something  
14:49 <+sburjan> yepp, works  
14:49 <+sburjan> I have the history  
14:49 <+sburjan> thanks !  
14:50 <+tmortagne> yep looks like it did not lost anything, except that now I don't have the skype notification icon anymore  
14:51 <+tmortagne> but it's actually "normal" according to https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/skype/+bug/764473 it's the fact that it was working before which is weird :|  
14:51 <+sburjan> windows systems were affected too  
14:51 <+sburjan> so I don't think it's a ubuntu issue  
14:51 <+tmortagne> well skype was not updated on ubuntu  
14:52 <+tmortagne> or you mean it has been caused by something inthe protocol ?  
14:53 <@cjdelisle> another buffer overflow :/  
14:53 <@cjdelisle> good 'ol skype, always run as nobody:nogroup  
14:53 <+sburjan> tmortagne: none of the windows machine is able to login ATM (without deleting the files you told me)  
14:54 <+tmortagne> sburjan: ok  
15:05 <@cjdelisle> sdumitriu: do you have an ETA on XWIKI-6580?  
15:11 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: release of RC1 is still due for Monday ? (I want to know so I have the time to test before the relesae)  
15:14 <@cjdelisle> I really really want to make this happen for Monday. If somebody holds it up then Monday will not be possible but I am planning on Monday.  
15:15 <@cjdelisle> switching xwiki-enterprise-tests back to only run on agent1, it's hard enough to make these fragile tests repeatable on a single box let alone 2.  
15:23 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <vmassol> has quit  
15:52 <jamesxu> Hi, I have a git problem: I want to sync with my local master branch with xwiki/platform:master branch  
15:53 <jamesxu> I use git fetch xwiki-platform/master  
15:53 <jamesxu> and then merge to local master  
15:54 <@cjdelisle> and you get an error message trying to fetch?  
15:55 <jamesxu> yes  
15:55 <jamesxu> Auto-merging xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-store/xwiki-platform-store-locks/pom.xml  
15:55 <jamesxu> CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-store/xwiki-platform-store-locks/pom.xml  
15:55 <jamesxu> Automatic merge failed; fix conflicts and then commit the result.  
15:55 <jamesxu> it is conflict  
15:55 <@cjdelisle> what I do is if I have any local changes which I need to make then I put them into a branch  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> so once I know there's nothing on the master which I care about...  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> I run  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> git reset --hard HEAD  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> then I do a  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> git pull  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> also git clean -dxf  
15:57 <@cjdelisle> which will remove all of the scraps from building  
15:59 <jamesxu> Yes, usually I will new a branch for issues, and each time I need to commit my works for issue, I will first pull the newest code from xwiki-platform and then rebese them to issue branch, finally I will push all the issue branch to my remote issue branch  
16:00 <jamesxu> is there any problem with it?  
16:00 <@cjdelisle> no, that seems right  
16:01 <@cjdelisle> All I'm saying is you don't want to do any git reset --hard until you are quite sure you have no important uncommitted code on your branch  
16:02 <@cjdelisle> (on the branch you are working on)  
16:02 <@cjdelisle> err  
16:03 <@cjdelisle> on the branch which git has currently selected  
16:03 <@cjdelisle> hope I didn't make that too confusing  
16:03 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:04 <jamesxu> ok, I am trying your advice  
16:04 <jamesxu> But I think the remote branch is also not clean now  
16:04 <@cjdelisle> do a git branch  
16:05 <@cjdelisle> see if you're on master  
16:05 <jamesxu> yes, I am on master  
16:05 <@cjdelisle> then do a git log and see if you accidently committed anything  
16:08 <jamesxu> I didn't do anything to my local master branch excpet to pull the new code from xwiki-platform/master  
16:08 <@cjdelisle> then do this:  
16:09 <@cjdelisle> git reset --hard HEAD && git clean -dxf && git pull  
16:13 <sburjan> has quit  
16:22 <jamesxu> yes I have done, now my branch is behind 'origin/master' by 148 commits, and can be fast-forwarded  
16:23 <jamesxu> how can I update origin/master to be the same as my local master branch?  
16:27 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:32 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
16:32 <@cjdelisle> no that means you are behind the origin master  
16:32 <@cjdelisle> so usually git pull is the thing to do  
16:39 <@sdumitriu> I'm back  
16:39 <@sdumitriu> jamesxu: Need help?  
16:42 <jamesxu> sdumitriu: I pull from xwiki-platform/master, but I git diff xwiki-platform/master there are still a lot of differences  
16:43 <jamesxu> I don't knwo why  
16:43 <jamesxu> -    <version>3.1-SNAPSHOT</version>  
16:43 <jamesxu> +    <version>3.1-milestone-3-SNAPSHOT</version>  
16:43 <jamesxu> above is the differences between local master band xwiki-platform/master  
16:44 <@cjdelisle> are you absolutely sure you are on master and tracking master because that change is in the 3.1M1 branch  
16:45 <@cjdelisle> \*m2  
16:47 <jamesxu> I clone the my local master from [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):jamesxu326/xwiki-platform.git  
16:47 <jamesxu> and pull the new codes from git://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform.git  
16:47 <jamesxu> am I right?  
16:50 <@cjdelisle> yes but you want to make sure you're pulling from git://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform.git master  
16:50 <@cjdelisle> rather than xwiki-3.1-milestone-2  
16:50 <@cjdelisle> in fact m2 is released so I'll delete the branch now  
16:53 <jamesxu> is 'git fetch xwiki-platfor master' right?  
16:54 <@cjdelisle> IIRC that will pull origin which is your repo  
16:54 <@cjdelisle> you want git fetch git://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform.git master  
16:55 <@cjdelisle> (I think)  
16:55 <jamesxu> I have add a remote named xwiki-platform point to git://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform.git  
16:55 <@cjdelisle> ahh i see  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> jamesxu: Don't try to pull directly in your branch  
16:59 <@sdumitriu> Create a new branch that tracks xwiki-platform  
16:59 <jamesxu> ok  
17:00 <@sdumitriu> git checkout -t -b xwiki-platform-master xwiki-platform/master  
17:00 <@sdumitriu> git pull  
17:01 <@sdumitriu> git checkout master  
17:01 <@sdumitriu> git merge xwiki-platform-master  
17:07 <jamesxu> ok now  
17:08 <jamesxu> I have done  
17:13 <jamesxu> now the local master is the same as xwiki-platform/master now  
17:23 <florinciu> has quit  
17:24 <mflorea> has quit  
17:26 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
17:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:43 <abusenius> has quit  
17:45 <+jvelociter> Hi guys  
17:45 <+jvelociter> where are plugins in brach stable-3.0.x ?  
17:45 <+jvelociter> I'm a bit lost  
17:49 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: nop  
17:49 <+tmortagne> we kind of "abandoned" them...  
17:50 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: you mean there are not there ?  
17:50 <+tmortagne> (for 3.0 branch)  
17:50 <+jvelociter> ah ok  
17:50 <+jvelociter> must be fixed on SVN ?  
17:50 <+tmortagne> not even  
17:50 <+tmortagne> svn is readonly  
17:50 <+jvelociter> (for XE 3.0.1 for example)  
17:50 <+jvelociter> ok  
17:51 <+jvelociter> so we can't really fix issues in plugins for the 3.0 branch ?  
17:51 <+tmortagne> lets say it was a risk taken considering that nothing critical would be found for 3.0 branch  
17:51 <+tmortagne> yep  
17:51 <+tmortagne> now we need to determine if it's ok or not in our current case  
17:51 <+jvelociter> pl  
17:51 <+jvelociter> s/pl/ok/  
17:52 <+tmortagne> it's probably possible to use 3.1 plugin in 3.0  
17:52 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
17:52 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
17:52 <+jvelociter> yep  
17:52 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:53 <+tmortagne> actually it's probably possible to build it but use it as it is could be hard on java 1.5 since it will be built with java 6  
18:01 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: is there any workaround that could be indicated in 3.0.1 release note or are we stuck ?  
18:01 <+jvelociter> outside the plugin ? mmh... not sure  
18:01 <+jvelociter> thinking  
18:01 <pulasthi1> has joined #xwiki  
18:01 <+tmortagne> at worst we cal always put watchlist plugin on xwiki-platform 3.0 branch  
18:01 <+tmortagne> either get trunk one and make it work with 3.0 or take the last svn one and apply fixes  
18:01 <+jvelociter> yep  
18:01 <pulasthi> has quit  
18:01 <arkub> has quit  
18:01 <+tmortagne> XWIKI-6649 is not very clean but it's not critical, I let you judge for XWIKI-6648  
18:01 <+jvelociter> 6648 is a bad bug... we've lived with it for a long time though  
18:01 <+jvelociter> (needs some conditions to show up)  
18:01 <+jvelociter> I'd like to ask JV  
18:01 <+jvelociter> he has the bug on cloud  
18:03 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: I don't understand what https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e745109e60e82c466b95f6382d3fafaf27abb246 is  
18:03 <+jvelociter> me neither :(  
18:03 <+jvelociter> :)  
18:03 <+jvelociter> git refused to let me push since you had pushed before me  
18:04 <+jvelociter> and asked me to pull before  
18:04 <+jvelociter> which I did  
18:04 <+tmortagne> maybe you pulled without --rebase  
18:04 <+jvelociter> but it added this commit  
18:04 <+jvelociter> ah  
18:04 <+jvelociter> right  
18:04 <+jvelociter> is there a way to delete it ?  
18:05 <+tmortagne> i don't think so, in any case the merge was needed I think since both our modification are almost on the same line  
18:05 <+tmortagne> btw good job for git for being able to merge that  
18:09 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
18:12 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: git config --global alias.up 'git pull --rebase'  
18:12 <@sdumitriu> Then you can "git up"  
18:12 <mflorea> has quit  
18:13 <+jvelociter> hehe  
18:18 <jamesxu> with the help of cjdelisle, the local master branch are the the same with remote xwiki-platform/master now, then I new a branch named issue5560, and add my changes to this branch, then commit, finally I git push origin master to the my own remote repo, but it shows 'Everything up-to-date'  
18:19 <jamesxu> I use diff, the local code didn't update to remote origin/master branch  
18:20 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
18:24 <arkub> has quit  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> You need to push the issue5560 branch, not the master  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> They are distinct  
18:25 <jvelociter\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:27 <jamesxu> you mean I should new a remote branch named issue5560, and then push to it ?  
18:28 <jvelociter> has quit  
18:28 <jvelociter\_> is now known as <jvelociter>  
18:30 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle : hi  
18:30 <@sdumitriu> jamesxu: No, I mean you have to push while on the issue5560 branch, not on the local master  
18:30 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
18:32 <jamesxu> yes, I first git checkout issue5560, and then git push orgin master, am I right?  
18:32 <pulasthi1> hey i tired to build platform today and got and error i built it before without any errors but now its saying this http://pastebin.com/CrVhGw4P  
18:32 <pulasthi1> any idea why  
18:32 <@sdumitriu> jamesxu: Right  
18:32 <@sdumitriu> jamesxu: Try: "git cherry"  
18:33 <@cjdelisle> do we still have xwiki-cache-oscache?  
18:34 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle : are you asking me that :)  
18:34 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Yes  
18:35 <@cjdelisle> hmm what version of maven are you running? mvn --version  
18:35 <jamesxu> but I can not push the changes of issue5560 to origin master, it shows Everything up-to-date, but I indeed add some changes to issue5560, and the last commit is Fri May 27 00:07:37 2011 +0800, but in origin/master the last commit time is Thu May 26 23:07:48 2011 +0800  
18:35 <pulasthi1> 2.2.1  
18:36 <jamesxu> I think it is ok to push the changes to origin/master, it should not be Everything up-to-date  
18:36 <@cjdelisle> I'm running a 3.0 snapshot, I winder if that might have something to do with it?  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> jamesxu: Try: "git cherry"  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> Does it print anything?  
18:36 <jamesxu> ok  
18:38 <pulasthi1> but i did a build successfully  few days ago  
18:39 <@cjdelisle> hmm I didn't commit any changes to my end  
18:39 <@sdumitriu> pulasthi1: Are you sure your sources are up to date?  
18:40 <pulasthi1> yep i did a upstream before building  
18:40 <@sdumitriu> pulasthi1: Try to build xwiki-commons first  
18:40 <@cjdelisle> attempying to repeat...  
18:41 <pulasthi1> ok  
18:41 <pulasthi1> thanks  
18:41 <@sdumitriu> commons-logging has been removed recently, so something is out of sync in there  
18:43 <jamesxu> I have tried git cherry origin/master  
18:43 <jamesxu> and it shows + d51730976202dcb485d1765bd201a9ac8b86a6a9  
18:43 <jamesxu> I use git show d51730976202dcb485d1765bd201a9ac8b86a6a9 to see what is it  
18:44 <jamesxu> the result is the diff result between issue5560 and origin/master  
18:45 <@sdumitriu> Ah, I know  
18:46 <@sdumitriu> "git push origin master" pushes the master branch  
18:46 <@sdumitriu> Try a simple "git push"  
18:46 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
18:46 <jamesxu> ok  
18:47 <jamesxu> also Everything up-to-date  
18:47 <@sdumitriu> Hm...  
18:47 <@sdumitriu> OK, the verbose way:  
18:47 <@sdumitriu> git push origin issue5560:master  
18:47 <pulasthi1> has quit  
18:50 <jamesxu> it works now~~~  
18:52 <@sdumitriu> OK, I think the problem was that the branch wasn't tracking a remote  
18:53 <jamesxu> yes, the issue5560 is created by 'git checkout -b issue5560'  
18:54 <jamesxu> it is not track the origin/master  
19:09 <@cjdelisle> be back later  
19:10 <@sdumitriu> Quick way of manually getting a version number from the current commit:  
19:10 <@sdumitriu> git log --oneline | wc -l
